intro: Blepharocalyx minutiflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered beautyberry, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, violet-blue berries that appear in clusters, which are a key feature of its botanical appearance. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape and have a smooth texture. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes other shrubs and vines. The flowers are small, white, and clustered, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
